title: Police Deems Afternoon Shooting Accidental
content:
Fresno, Calif.
An shooting in Fresno that injured a 19-year-old man is deemed an accident by Fresno Police.
According to a statement released by Fresno Police Thursday evening, officers responded to a call of a shooting victim at the 2500 block of West Fairmont, near Marks. Police said that was the second shooting reported in that block on Thursday.
The first shooting, police said, happened at approximately 5:30 a.m., and left a man wounded.
According to police, the 19-year-old victim was struck once by gunfire, and said he was standing in front of his apartment when he was shot by an unknown suspect. However, police said an examination of the scene revealed evidence and witness statements that conflicted with the victim's account.
Detectives, according to police, have determined that a group of young men were smoking marijuana and playing with a handgun at the apartment with the victim when the gun went off, and struck the victim. Police said the person responsible for firing the gun has not been located, and the investigation is ongoing.
While police believe the shooting is accidental, officials said they need to locate and identify the persons present to complete the investigation. Anyone with information on the case is urged to call Crime Stoppers at 498-STOP.
